page.title: 13Shopping in Llanelli.
page.content: Llanelli's main shopping area consists of five streets which have been pedestrianized,together with a new Market Hall,opened in 1970,with a space for casual traders,partly under cover,and along an unpedestrianized road.Market days are Thursday and Saturday,while early closing is on Tuesday.The Market Hall houses a variety of stall holders and includes a wet fish area and two stalls selling the local speciality-Lava Bread.(Boiled Seaweed.)Most of the large chain stores have branches in the block including Boots,Marks and Spencer,W.H.Smith,Woolworth,and Tesco.There are a plethora of shoe shops and Building Societies.A few small family corner shops are left,and they make their contribution to Llanelli shopping by staying open late in the evening and opening on Sundays.
